Enjoy the fifth year of the Cartographer's Annaul with this amazing collection. The Annual continues to inspire CC3 users with its variety and depth of styles, symbols, tutorials and examples. Dig into a year's worth of material for your maps and projects with this package. Style Packs: CC3's new features make it easy to set up a collection of tools that produce a new and unique style in your maps. The hard part is often coming up with the original idea and design. The Cartographer's Annual aims to produce a wide variety of such styles to give you an out-of-the-box way to make your maps look fresh and serve as inspiration for your own designs. Each style pack is accompanied by a mapping guide which tells you how to use the templates, drawing tools and symbols and takes you step-by-step through the creation of an example map in this new style. Symbols: Occasionally the Cartographer's Annual will provide new symbol sets designed to create a specific type of map or to supplement an existing set. Map Collections: Some types of maps crop up again and again in role-playing games: taverns, caves, small villages and their ilk. The Annual will supply example maps for these that can be quickly adapted to your own needs. It will also include ideas and suggestions for encounters and adventures in those locations.

boardgame.name: MOD X
boardgame.description:
In the abstract strategy game MOD X, each player has 14 game pieces and 18 score markers, with the goal being to reach an established number of points (determined by the number of players). Players take turns placing a game piece on the board and trying to create scoring patterns – an "X", a "+", or a line, with each pattern requiring five pieces – while simultaneously trying to block their opponents from scoring with these same patterns.

After creating a successful pattern, a player places score markers on the board marking these spaces. Players can lose their score markers, however, if opponents create scoring patterns over these score markers on a later turn.

The game ends when one player reaches the established number of points (and wins) or a player runs out of pieces; in this latter case the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Canvas Quest: negociação
boardgame.description:
Game to teach negotiation skills and also The Business Model Generation. This is a methodology to help entrepreneurs to establish a successful business model based on a graphic approach called Canvas. The Canvas has 9 areas that any strategic plan and/or business plan should focus: Key Resources, Key Partners, Value Proposition, Customer Segments, Customer Relationship, Key Activities, Cost Structure, Revenue streams, Channels.

Each player or group of players will represent a character. The character is one of the managers a typical company will find. Sales Manager, Production Manager and HR Manager are some examples. Each character has some expertise and this expertise allows him to have some skill cards. The game has 5 boards, each board is a company of the same corporation. Each company has a sales goal and the corporation also has a sales goal.

Each round a new crisis/opportunity must be faced by the players, that must co-operate to get the business results desired. They must discuss the crisis/opportunity, suggest a solution to the problem and add skill cards with enough points to solve the problem. The players roleplay their character, move the character thru the board representing the Canvas areas, get new skills, negotiate with the other companies for resources and pick actions to help the company goals. The game ends after 3 hours of play and the results are analized to check if the goals were achieved.

boardgame.name: Blocks in the West
Blocks in the West: The Collector's Edition
Blocks in the West: The Limited Edition
boardgame.description:
Early in the morning of May 10, 1940, under the Codeword Danzig, Fallschirmjäger from the 7th Flieger Division and 22nd Luftlande executed surprise landings at Den Haag, on the road to Rotterdam and against the Fortress of Eben Emael in order to facilitate German Army Group B's feint advance in Belgium, while the main attack was conducted by stronger Army Group A led by seven panzer divisions from the Ardennes, through a terrain believed uncrossable to armor units. France and the UK reacted immediately, activating the Dyle-Breda Plan, and thus committing their best forces directly into the trap. Then in June the evacuation of Dunkirk was a partial success, but the battle for France was over with an astonishing German victory. Four years elapsed before the Western Allies would come back to the continent and thus finally defeat Germany.

Blocks in the West (BITW) recalls, in game form, the most decisive battles fought in the European Theater Front from the invasion of France until the collapse of the Nazi regimen in May 1945. BITW is a game of World War II conflict simulation at the operational level. Although based on historical events and battles, the players in command of the two factions can modify the evolution of World War II on the Western Front. The game is recommended for two, three or four players: one/two control the Western Allies and the other one/two control Germany and Italy. The game is imminently suitable for solitary play: the single player just controls both sides. In this case, playing with Fog of War is mandatory.

Developed on a wooden blocks and cubes system over an astonishing 124x87cm full-laminated multicolor map board, Blocks in the West includes no paper components other than the manual. All of the over 900 wooden/plastic components/stickers have been created by the best Italian artisinal industry and painted A buratto, a technique usually adopted for painting car parts and accessories. In terms of scale, a hexagon is approximately 44 miles (70 km) across, a game turn is one month long, and a full-strength counter represents a major military formation (normally a corps) of ca. 30,000 men, 300 Tanks or 300 planes depending on the unit type, equipment, nationality, etc

The rules are divided into three major sections which can be learned one at a time. The basic game rules introduce the basic concepts and enables players to start playing the game without too many rules to remember. Then the advanced game rules provide more specific and detailed rules for an enhanced realism, such as the use of fuel and the advanced production system. Finally, for those players who want to get the best out of the game, optional rules can be added as desired; these include Technology Research, Strategic warfare over German factories and U-Boot Campaign in the Atlantic Ocean, Amphibious Invasions, and Parachute Assaults.

Blocks in the West can be played standalone or combined with Blocks in the East and Blocks in Afrika.

Our Terms and Conditions
1. General
All transactions between Gamers HQ and you, the customer, are subject to the following conditions, which you acknowledge by accepting delivery of your ordered products. These conditions do not affect your statutory rights and in all cases German law applies.
2. Orders and prices
We do our level best to ensure that the information on our website is up-to-date. Please note that offers and prices are subject to change. We work to ensure that our prices are all correct, but cannot be held responsible for accidentally displaying the wrong price of a product.
All prices are quoted in Euros and already include all necessary taxes.
3. Lead times and delivery costs
Our products are delivered directly from our Berlin base, and orders are usually dispatched within two working days. Dispatch and transport are at the expense of the customer. We usually ship orders with DHL but explicitly reserve the right to choose another method of transport. If an order is split into several deliveries, each delivery counts as a separate transaction.
Delivery within Germany is free of charge if your order amounts to a total of 50 euros or more. Below that amount, we charge a one-off fee of 5 euros.
Our products can also be ordered for delivery outside Germany. In that case, an estimate of the delivery costs is added to your order during checkout. Please note that this delivery cost estimate does not necessarily constitute the final amount. We shall contact you personally by email after you have placed your order to present you with delivery options and to quote the final price for delivery costs.
4. Payment options
We currently offer the following three payment options: direct debit from your bank account (only within Germany), bank transfer (prepayment) and PayPal. Once you have placed three orders, we also offer you the option to pay by invoice. Such privileges can, however, be withdrawn should we encounter repeated delays in settling invoices.
5. Cancellations, Refunds & Returns Should you wish to cancel your order, you can do so by notifying us by fax, email, letter or by simply returning your product(s) to Gamers HQ. No questions asked. Please note that such a cancellation has to be done within two weeks after having received your ordered product(s). Should you have already paid for your order, we shall refund those costs to you as soon as we have received your cancellation notification. Please ensure that any products returned are in good condition. If you check the products in a manner that you will have done, for example, in a shop, this is fine. Any other handling of the product(s) might entitle Gamers HQ to some compensation from you, which might in rare cases amount to the original sum paid for the product(s). So should you feel that you might cancel your order by returning the products, please limit your inspection of the products to optical checks and do not use them on a regular basis. If you return your order within two weeks in the above manner, we shall refund you the costs for sending the product(s) back to us (unless your cancelled order amounts less than 20 euros, in which case you as the customer will bear the cost of return postage). Please ensure that you use appropriate packing material when sending back the product(s) — preferably using the original wrapping. Please note that German law, following the EU directive 97/7/EG of 20 May 1997, specifies that the right to return items and receive a full refund is not applicable to the purchase of newspapers, magazines or journals (§312d BGB) as well as the purchase of audio- or video-recordings and software once you have broken the seal of the package. Should we accidently send you the wrong products, please return them to us and we shall refund you the return postage immediately. Any cancellation of an order has to be done in writing (by post, fax or email). 6. Ownership
Please note that ordered products remain our property until you have fully paid for them.
7. Personal data
We are committed to protecting your personal information and will keep the information you entrust to us safely and securely. We may collect information from you to monitor website visitor patterns, so that we can improve our website. We also collect information from you to handle orders, deliver products and services, process payments, communicate with you about orders, products and services, update our records and generally maintain your customer profile with us. However, we shall never sell or share your personal information with third parties. Our customer data — in so far as required to provide the above services and within the limits defined by the data protection laws of Germany (paragraph 26 BDSG) — is saved and handled on a separate, network-independent computer.

We reserve the right to reject orders without any explanation. Also please note that you as a customer cannot assert a claim against Gamers HQ if, for whatever reason, we are unable to source the item(s) you have ordered. Although we check the content of external links provided on our website, we have no control over or responsibility for these domains to which we provide the links or which link to us. That responsibility solely rests with those who manage the respective domains.
10. Place of jurisdiction
Any disputes arising hereunder will be settled before a Berlin court. We reserve the right to choose the customer's place of jurisdiction instead.

If parts of these terms and conditions become ineffective, the remainder of these terms still apply.

[...]
Ein FATE für Spieler, die hauptsächlich Erzählen wollen und Spaß am gemeinsamen Entwickeln einer Geschichte haben. Denen wichtig ist, wie ein Charakter ist, nicht, was er kann. Und dies in Kombination mit einem System, das dem Spielfluss nicht im Weg steht, das aber, wenn es gebraucht wird, dennoch alle nötigen Mechanismen der Konfliktlösung zur Verfügung stellt. Ein schlankes FATE also, das man schnell, unkompliziert und ohne große Vorbereitung spielen kann – ein FATE to go.

FateToGo ist ein Spiel, das für Oneshots entwickelt wurde, also für Spielrunden, die wenige Stunden in Anspruch nehmen. Es wird dir nicht dabei helfen, eine Spielwelt möglichst exakt und detailliert zu simulieren. Es ist ein Erzählspiel mit einem Leichtbau-Regelgerüst, das an etlichen Stellen bewusst offen gehalten ist. Es kann und will nicht all die vielen verschiedenen Situationen im Rollensiel abbilden, für die man Regeln formulieren könnte, sondern konzentriert sich darauf, die Standardsituationen abbilden zu können. Wo FateToGo als System zu grobmaschig ist, vertraut es darauf, dass du und deine Mitspieler gemeinsam Lösungen finden, die zu euch und eurem Spielstil passen.
Dennoch ist es immer noch ein Kind der FATE-Familie und damit grundsätzlich kompatibel zu anderen FATE-Varianten. Wenn dir und deiner Gruppe bestimmte Regelelemente aus anderen FATE-Systemen gefallen, können sie mit wenig Aufwand für FateToGo angepasst und in eure Spielrunde integriert werden.

translation by Google

FateToGo is a highly streamlined version of FATE, with a special focus on the narrative approach of the game.
[...]
A FATE for players who want to have fun and narration chiefly on developing a common history. Which is important as a character is not what he does. And this in combination with a system similar to the flow of the game is out of the way, but that, when it is needed, but all the necessary mechanisms of conflict resolution provides. A slim FATE so that you can play quickly, easily and without much preparation - a FATE to go.

FateToGo is a game that was developed for Oneshots, so for rounds, take a few hours to complete. It will not help you to simulate a game world as precisely and in detail. It is a narrative game with a lightweight control framework, which is in some places deliberately kept open. It can not and will not represent all the many different situations in Rollensiel for which one could formulate rules but rather focuses on mapping the standard situations. Where FateToGo is too coarse as a system, it is confident that you and your teammates find solutions that fit you and your style of play.
Nevertheless, it is still a child of the FATE family and thus in principle compatible with other FATE variants. If you and your group like certain elements from other FATE rule systems, they can be adjusted with little effort for FateToGo and integrated into your round.

boardgame.name: ViewScream (2nd Ed. Playtest)
boardgame.description:
Author's description:
ViewScream is a role-playing game designed for Google+ Hangout. It’s a low-prep game, and requires 2 ten-sided dice.

Premise: Four officers (Medical, Bridge, Weapons, and Engineering) find themselves aboard a damaged starship, in great peril. They’re cut off from each other, and can only communicate via viewscreens throughout the ship.

Will you turn on your shipmates? Will you work with them, even though some of them may be guilty of horrific crimes? What happened to the rest of the crew? How many minutes do you have before it happens to you, too? Can you escape? Can you trust your shipmates? Will someone find your mangled corpse floating in the void?

This is a drama-heavy game, lots of scenery-chewing, and players stay in character the whole time (about 90 minutes).
